titleStmt.title: R. H. J. Goddard, Special Orders, No. 256
CWG14250

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 6

body.p:
Headquarters Department of the Ohio
Cincinnati, Ohio, July 7th 1863.

3 " " " Sergeant Major, M. B. Pulliam 11th Cavalry Kentucky Volunteers, is discharged the service, to date from the sixth (6th) day of December 1862, to enable him to accept a Commission then tendered him by the Governor of Kentucky and since when he has been acting in the capacity of a Commissioned Officer.

By order of Major General Burnside.
R H J Goddard
Acting Assistant Adjutant General.

11 Cavy
Serg. Maj.
Pulliam
Disch,
Filed July 27, 1863
